result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig Eugene Alberta

Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich in court for Craig Eugene Alberta.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.

DTC - PHASE 1

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program. No points awarded. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta appeared by video.  Attorney Zoe Plovanich appeared by video for Craig Eugene Alberta.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.

Review Hearing proceeded.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  The Court commended the defendant for compliance with the program and awarded the defendant 1 points. Defendant has been chosed as the PERSON OF THE WEEK. $10.00 giftcard awarded to the defendant from the fishbowl.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract, case adjourned for review hearing, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Review hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed.
Defendant is to have no contact with Walgreens and Target. Defendant is to comply with all of the terms of the DTC.   Court ordered turnover to JusticePoint when released from custody.

Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

AS TO COUNT ONE; The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months. 

Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Drug Treatment
Guilty Plea Questionnaire & Addendum to the Questionnaire
Jury Instructions

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Craig Eugene Alberta not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense seeking DTC entry. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant.  (Craig E. Alberta - #2022001199, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Craig Eugene Alberta not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: City of Wauwatosa Police Officer KarlSteberl.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
On Courts own motion. All other conditions of bail remain as previously set.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court by video, defendant Craig Eugene Alberta not in court, in custody.  Samantha Raygo appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

OFF THE RECORD: Parties are not present.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing 2/22/2022. Milwaukee County Office of Emergency Management declared a snow emergency for 2/22/2022 therefore this matter will be rescheduled. A new date has been selected with Attorney Roozen by email. Case is adjourned for CAUSE a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with All Milwaukee County Targets
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Defendant Craig Eugene Alberta in custody.  Mark O Thomson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
